> <OLD>  
>
> Straight Shot sits well in Kups hands, ready and rearing for=
 battle.
>
> "Okay, let's get this party started. It's about time we stuck =
a few arrows up lizard afts tail end."
>
> Night Shift chuckles at Straight=
 Shot's statement, as he acklowledges Perceptor's downloads.
>
> " Gettn' '=
em now Perceptor. Maaaan talk about heavy intel. There's no chance I'm gonn=
a get lost now. Hmmm, I might be able ta configure a safe short cut inta th=
e fortress... Any chance ya got the codes ta disable any security software =
I might have ta know about?"
>
> Tucson waits patiently for Cheetor's news =
of clear passage as he transforms into his vehicle mode, opening his doors =
to Lord Elder, and Talon. His engine rumbles at the start yet runs quietly =
after being started, which was a signature trade mark of his previous vehic=
le form, who's engine was barely even heard when standing idol. Night Shift=
 also gets into vehicle form, opening his doors to Windlord and Perceptor. =
His engine silences after being started yet remains idol.
>
> " Night Shift=
, as soon as Cheetor comes back, and relays the intel, you will slowly adva=
nce into position with Perceptor and Windlord. Take your time, we are not r=
ushing into this because the faster we travel, the faster we will raise sus=
picion. Feel free to take any path you wish. If you wish to go off road, ev=
en better. Try not to kick up any dust on your tires if you can help it."
>=

> Night Shift nodds.
>
> "Gotchya. If anyone can roll in silent mode, it's=
 me."
>
> Tucson then turns to Rodimus.
>
> "If I can get everyone to move =
in slowly, we have a very good chance of going unseen and unheard. I also p=
lan to send a mild sonar wave which should mask all our signatures, includi=
ng those of Perceptors, by using a signal configuration code. I haven't tri=
ed doing that but I do know my sonar system can work around various codes a=
nd configure a buffer that will not harm anyone who isn't under our signatu=
re. If at any time, you feel that our plan is not working, feel free to int=
ervine".
>
> Quickstride then turns to Lord Elder and Rodimus.
>
> "I shoul=
d definitely be able to smell trouble if it comes. And don't worry, I won't=
 let anyone down. Just to let you guys know, I work better in beast form, s=
ince that's where all my senses are. Well, I better get out there'n start p=
atrol duty. You'll know where ta find me. QUICKSTRIDE, MAXIMIZE!"
>
> With =
that he gets into his equine mode and walks out instead of bolting out of t=
he Ark, to keep suspcions low. He sniffs the ground and as part of the illu=
sion, nibbles at a few blades of grass. Yet, his ears remain focused on the=
 task at hand as does his eyes and nose. He raises his head while nibbling,=
 remaining still and doing what horses do best, which was staying still, an=
d occasionally lowering their heads for a few snips of grass.
>

<NEW>

Rod=
imus nodded as he brought his console fully online. Screens lit up as commu=
nication gear began to glow with readiness. "We will do what we can." He sa=
id, his voice, despite his words, was full of confidence. 

"Be careful." L=
ord Elder said, his voice, as always the voice of reason. "I can send Rodim=
us to back you up if need be, but our sensors will not be able to track you=
 beyond a certain point. You will be on your own unless you call us."

"But=
 if you call, we will be ready." Rodimus said, the old enthusiasm creeping =
back into his voice.

"Cheetor to base!" Cheetor's voice crackeled over the=
 comm.-channel. "I've gotten here." He said, he was obviously out of breath=
 from the travel. 

Cheetor whisteled over the channel, "You should see wha=
t they've done." Cheetor is not equipped with cameras, but his voice contin=
ued, "The base looks totally rebuilt, like some sort of fortified tower, en=
cased in armor." 

There is a pause, the sound of movement, probably Cheeto=
r, and then he continued, "There is a small lake of magma here, and the tow=
er is sitting in the *middle* of it. If you can't fly, you are going to hav=
e trouble getting to it." There was another pause, "From what my thermal sc=
anners tell me, the surface of the tower is HOT, all that hot rock sitting =
near it."

The sound of more movement, "Slag!" The sound of movement, "I se=
e one . . . two . . . three?? Scourge's flying around here." He sounded def=
initely confused. "They seem to be patrolling." His voice dropped to a whis=
per, "I'm signing off, I think they can hear me . . ." 

<Click> the line i=
s shut off. 

Lord Elder turned to look at Tuscon as Rodimus stood up tryin=
g to reopen the comm-channel, "Cheetor! CHEETOR!!!"

The channel remained s=
ilent. 

(TAG)

Preston
